required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Retrospective Evaluation of Posterior Direct Restorations
clinical_study.official_title: Five-year Retrospective Clinical Evaluation of Multi-surface Amalgam and Resin Composite Restorations Placed by Dental Students

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective study aims to evaluate the clinical performance of posterior multi-surface Class II amalgam (AM) and resin composite (RC) restorations placed by dental students over a five-year period.

detailed_description.textblock: Purpose: The aim of this retrospective study is to evaluate the clinical performance of posterior multi-surface Class II amalgam (AM) and resin composite (RC) restorations placed by dental students over a five-year period. Materials and Methods: A total of 119 multi-surface Class II restorations (three or more surfaces) placed by third and fourth year students will be evaluated (AM: n = 69 and RC: n = 50). Restorations were assessed clinically according to the USPHS criteria by two independent evaluators using mirrors and probes. Data will be analyzed using Chisquare, Mann-Whitney and Wilcoxon tests at a 0.05 level of significance.

primary_outcome.description: No Patient-reported sensitivity to hot and cold stimuli, sweets, clenching, and chewing related to the restoration (Alpha)
No visual evidence of dark, deep discoloration adjacent to the restoration (Alpha)
No open contact. Contact offers resistance to the dental floss (Alpha)
Restoration closely adapted to the tooth. No crevice visible (Alpha)
Restorations continuous with existing anatomic form (Alpha)

arm_group.description: Multi-surface amalgam restorations performed by dental students and are in function for about 5 years.
Multi-surface composite restorations performed by dental students and are in function for about 5 years.

intervention.intervention_name: Retrospective evaluation of amalgam and composite restorations
intervention.description: Multi-surface restorations that were performed by dental students and that are in function for the last five years will be clinically evaluated with mirrors and probes according to the modified USPHS criteria.

study_pop.textblock: Adults patients who had complex amalgam or resin composite restorations (three or more surfaces) placed on molar or premolar areas by dental students in the Adult Dental Clinic over a five-year period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Presence of multi-surface (three or more surfaces) composite or amalgam restorations placed by dental students over a five-year period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Children
- Restorations performed before or after five years on the time of evaluation
- Restorations with fewer than 3 surfaces

facility.name: Schulich Medicine and Dentistry - Western University
